darwpy package¶

Submodules¶

darwpy.algos module¶

darwpy.algos.GA(domain, fitness, N=50, generations=1000)¶
Parameters

  • domain (dict) – A <domain> dictionary

  • fitness (func) – A fitness function that accepts a sol

  • N (int) – The number of individuals per generation

  • generations (int) – The number of generations

Returns

tuple containing:

  • np.array : The 2D array with the final solutions

  • np.array : The fitness profile as 1D

Return type

(tuple)

darwpy.operators module¶

darwpy.operators.draw_sol(domain_gene)¶

Given the <domain>, draw a valid solution for gene <i>

darwpy.operators.evaluate(pop, fitness_func, fit_col=-1, extra_cols=2)¶
Args

pop (np.array) : The matrix of solution to score fitness_func (obj): The fitness function

Returns

np.array :

darwpy.operators.init_pop(N, domain, fitness_func)¶
darwpy.operators.mutate(sol, domain, mut_prob=0.02, mut_idx=[])¶

Mutates a solution

Parameters

  • sol (np.array) – A solution vector [vector inlclues only genes]

  • domain (dict) – The DOMAIN dictionary containing info for each gene

  • mut_prob (float) – The probability to mutate each gene [0,1]

  • mut_idx (list) – If provided, will only mutate (with mut_prob=1) these indeces

Returns

The (mutated) solution

Return type

np.array

Note

No checks on <mut_prob> to ensure it is within [0,1] No checks if indeces in mut_idx are outside the size of <sol> and <domain>

darwpy.operators.recombine(sol1, sol2, recomb_events=1, hot_regions=None)¶

Recombines sol1 and sol2

Parameters

  • sol1 (np.array) – The solution vector for parent 1 [vector inlclues only genes]

  • sol1 – The solution vector for parent 2 [vector inlclues only genes]

  • recomb_events (int) – The number of recombinations taking place

  • hot_regions (list) – Default is None, but if supplied sum(hot_regions) = 1 The probabilites of recomb for each locus in sol

Returns

The recombined solution

Return type

np.array

Note:

darwpy.operators.sort_pop(pop, gen_col=-2, fit_col=-1)¶
Args

pop (np.array): TYPE gen_col (int): TYPE, optional fit_col (int): TYPE, optional

Returns

np.array : The sorted <POP> 2d array accroding to the criteria

Note

Currently sorting on fitness,generations that tends to keep older (good) solutions in the population

darwpy.operators.strategy_breed(parents, nkids, domain, genN, pS1=0.2, mut_prob=0.2)¶

Get the next generation by rotating the elite parents

Args

parents (np.array): The 2D matrix with the parents (last column is fitness) nkids (int) : The number of kids to produce domain (dict) : genN (int) : The generation number to mark in kids pS1 (float) : The proportion of elite parents [0-1 range] mut_prob (float) : The mutation probability to pass to mutate()

Returns

np.array : a 2D matrix with the new kids
